title: The Masked Singer's Darren McMullen says the secrecy 'annoyed' his family
text:
Former The Voice host Darren McMullen unveiled himself as the prawn during The Masked Singer on Monday night.

And now the 37-year-old have revealed how difficult it was to keep his involvement in the hit show a secret.

Speaking to The Daily Telegraph on Tuesday, Darren revealed a number of his friends and family were annoyed at the mysterious project.

'Hopefully they will start talking to me again': The Masked Singer's Darren McMullen (pictured) has said the secrecy around the show 'annoyed' his family during an interview with The Daily Telegraph on Tuesday

'It's been really tough (keeping the secret), especially with family and friends,' he told the publication.

He went on to explain how he now hoped they understood why he had to be so secretive about his time on stage.

'They all knew I was back working on something but the fact that I wouldn't tell them what annoyed the hell out of them,' he said.

Secret: 'They all knew I was back working on something but the fact that I wouldn't tell them what annoyed the hell out of them,' Darren (pictured) said. Here with family

'Hopefully they'll understand why I couldn't say anything now and they will start talking to me again.'

The House Husbands stars shocked everyone when he took off the mask, with Darren revealing he had never sung before the show.

He said: 'My whole life, I've wanted to sing, I've wanted to be on stage, I wanted to do that.

Passion: 'My whole life, I've wanted to sing, I've wanted to be on stage, I wanted to do that," Darren said when he was unmasked during Monday night's episode

'And if I can do that somehow with a mask and hidden behind this prawn, that would be a great opportunity.'

During the episode, Dannii Minogue was relieved that the prawn wasn't her model ex Kris Smith.

A number of her co-judges believed Dannii might have had a connection with the prawn prior to his unmasking.

Stardom: Darren is the fifth celebrity to get unmasked on the show. Former NRL star Wendell Sailor, cricketer Brett Lee and singer Nikki Webster have all appeared on the series

Darren is the fifth celebrity to get unmasked on the show.

Former NRL star Wendell Sailor, cricketer Brett Lee and singer Nikki Webster have all appeared on the series.

The Masked Singer continues on Channel Ten, Tuesday, 7.30pm.
